alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 07 at 5:51PM EDT until October 08 at 6:10PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of eastern Clinton County and northeastern Essex County in northern New York. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 548 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from current rainfall. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Plattsburgh, Plattsburgh International Airport, Peru, Beekmantown, Schuyler Falls, Chazy, Saranac, Mooers, Altona, Rouses Point, Jericho, Dannemora, Peasleeville, Keeseville, Au Sable Forks, Champlain, Black Brook, West Plattsburgh and Cadyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
